Title:
Disentangling a 40-year-old taxonomic puzzle: phylogenetic
position of Mimulicalyx (Lamiales)
Keywords:
Lamiales  molecular systematics  Phrymaceae  Plastome 
Scrophulariaceae
Abstract:
With the disintegration of the traditionally circumscribed
Scrophulariaceae, the phylogenetic placement of most genera formerly
placed within that family were resolved. However, the familial placement
of the monotypic genus Mimulicalyx has not been included in any
published molecular phylogenetic studies. In the present study we adopt
a two-step approach to resolve the phylogenetic placement of Mimulicalyx
using three datasets: (1) a 71,619 bp plastome alignment of Lamiales;
(2) a dataset of six chloroplast DNA regions (atpB, matK, ndhF, rbcL,
rps16, and trnL-trnF) for Phrymaceae, and (3) a dataset of the nuclear
ribosomal internal and external transcribed spacer regions (nrITS, ETS)
for Phrymaceae. Our analyses reveal that Mimulycalyx is a member of the
tribe Mimuleae within Phrymaceae. Generic level phylogenetic
relationships within Phrymaceae are further discussed, and a dichotomous
key to the 14 genera currently recognized is provided.
